faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our programs, schedules, and admissions.

questions.q: What age groups do you accept?
questions.a: We accept students as young as 4 years old for our introductory Qaida/Noorani classes. We have specialized programs tailored for children, teenagers, and even adults who wish to perfect their recitation.

questions.q: Do you offer both online and physical classes?
questions.a: Yes! We have a physical campus in Montreal for in-person learning, which fosters community and brotherhood. We also offer comprehensive online classes via Zoom/LMS for students who cannot attend in person, ensuring quality education worldwide.

questions.q: Do you provide female teachers for girls?
questions.a: Yes, we have dedicated and highly qualified female Quran teachers for our sisters and young girls. We ensure a comfortable and private learning environment that respects Islamic values while fostering spiritual growth.

questions.q: What curriculum do you follow for Tajweed and Qaida?
questions.a: We use the world-renowned Noorani Qaida for beginners to build a strong foundation. For Tajweed, we follow a structured curriculum covering all essential rules (Makharij, Sifaat, etc.) to ensure students recite the Quran accurately as revealed to Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).

questions.q: Can I choose my own class timing?
questions.a: We offer various time slots for both online and physical classes. For our private one-on-one sessions, we provide maximum flexibility, allowing parents to choose timings that best fit their child's school and extracurricular schedule.

questions.q: How do you monitor and report student progress?
questions.a: We provide regular monthly progress reports to parents. Our teachers maintain a daily log of lessons, memorization progress, and areas for improvement. Periodic assessments are conducted to ensure high standards of Quranic education.

hero.description: Nurturing the next generation with the light of the Quran and the beauty of Islamic character since 2015.

history.title: Our Humble Beginnings
history.p1: Aisha Academy started as a small weekend school in a local community center in Montreal. Driven by the community's need for high-quality, structured Quranic education, we have grown into a fully-fledged institute serving hundreds of students both locally and globally.
history.p2: Named after the Mother of Believers, Aisha (RA), a beacon of knowledge, our academy strives to embody her legacy of scholarship and piety.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.desc: To provide high-quality, accessible Quranic education that empowers children to connect with their faith, understand the Holy Book, and embody its teachings in their daily lives. We strive to create a generation that leads with knowledge and compassion.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.desc: A world where every Muslim child has the opportunity to learn the Quran with love and understanding, building a strong foundation of faith that guides them through all walks of life.
